Article.ArticleTitle: [T- and B-lymphocytes in patients with chronic renal failure and in recipients of cadaveric allokidneys during the immediate posttransplant period]

Abstract.AbstractText: Investigations of the thymus-dependent and thymus-independent lymphocytes populations of patients with chronic renal failure showed the activity of the T-lymphocytes system to be depressed in these cases. Both the lymphocyte populations took part in the rejection, but the degree of their participation differed. There was a low activation of T-lymphocytes and a high activation of B-lymphocytes in case of inflammatory processes, abscess, frunculosis, hematoma, etc., when stable doses of immunodepressants were used. The evidence of participation of T- and B-lymphocytes in the rejection opens new approaches to the diagnosis of different pathological conditions in the recipient's organism.
